### pushValueAndType() {#ade8e00c560f86ba453b17752abc24d22}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool DXILBitcodeWriter::pushValueAndType (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; V, unsigned InstID, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; unsigned &gt; &amp; Vals)</>}>
pushValueAndType - The file has to encode both the value and type id for many values, because we need to know what type to create for forward references.

However, most operands are not forward references, so this type field is not needed.

This function adds V&#39;s value <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#abdf8cf606905c10634e831390981b0ed">ID</a> to Vals. If the value <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#abdf8cf606905c10634e831390981b0ed">ID</a> is higher than the instruction <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#abdf8cf606905c10634e831390981b0ed">ID</a>, then it is a forward reference, and it also includes the type <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#abdf8cf606905c10634e831390981b0ed">ID</a>. The value <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#abdf8cf606905c10634e831390981b0ed">ID</a> that is written is encoded relative to the InstID.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/directx/lib/target/directx/dxilwriter/dxilbitcodewriter-cpp/#l00335">335</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/directx/lib/target/directx/dxilwriter/dxilbitcodewriter-cpp">DXILBitcodeWriter.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
